src:
Po iztirjenju vlaka pri Zidanem Mostu manjše zamude v prometu
06 Nov 2019, 10:17 by STA

Potem ko je ponoči pri Zidanem Mostu iztiril tovorni vlak, potniški in tovorni promet na območju potekata z minimalnimi zamudami, so sporočili s Slovenskih železnic. Kot so pojasnili, je levi tir proge Breg-Zidani Most je zaradi dogodka zaprt, desni pa je bil odprt ob 4.16. Potniški in tovorni promet potekata po desnem tiru.



Fotografija je simbolična. Foto: Slovenske železnice

ZIDANI MOST > Kot so še pojasnili na Slovenskih železnicah, je do nesreče prišlo, ko je na železniški postaji Breg iztirila os na podstavnem vozičku 16. vagona tovornega vlaka z 19 vagoni. Vlak je nato z iztirjeno osjo vozil do Zidanega Mosta, kjer je ob prihodu na kretniško območje iztiril. Poškodovanih ni, nastala je gmotna škoda.
Preiskava nesreče poteka, o izrednem dogodku so obveščeni vsi pristojni organi, so sporočili iz Slovenskih železnic. To je sicer že tretja nesreča v zadnjih treh mesecih na tem območju.
Podrobnosti bo ob 11.30 v Ljubljani predstavil direktor SŽ-Infrastruktura Matjaž Kranjc.
text:
Following the train derailment at Zidani Most, there were minor traffic delays
06 Nov 2019, 10:17 by STA

After picking up a freight train at Zidani Most at night, passenger and freight traffic in the area are running with minimal delays, Slovenian Railways said. As they explained, the left track of the Breg-Zidani Most line was closed due to the event and the right track was opened at 4.16. Passenger and freight traffic are on the right track.



Photography is symbolic. Photo: Slovenian Railways

THE WALLED BRIDGE> As explained on the Slovenian Railways, the accident occurred when the axle on the bogie of the 16th wagon of a 19-wagon freight train was derailed at the Breg railway station. The train then, with the derailed axle, drove to Zidani Most, where on arriving at the crossing area it derailed. There were no injuries, and a lot of damage was done.
The accident is being investigated and all competent authorities are informed of the emergency, Slovenian Railways said. This is the third accident in the area in the last three months.
Details will be presented at 11.30 in Ljubljana by the director of SŽ-Infrastruktura Matjaž Kranjc.
